text: In geology, a boulder is a large piece of rock fragment that is larger than 25.6cm or roughly 10.1 inches in diameter or with a size value less than -8 on the φ particle size scale with no upper size limit. == References == # Webster’s New International Dictionary of the English Language. Springfield, Massachusetts: G. & C. Merriam Company. 1913. # "Boulder". Dictionary.com. Retrieved 24 August 2013. === Citations === # "Boulder". Collins English Dictionary. == Other websites == * Media related to Boulders at Wikimedia Commons Category:Rocks
title: Boulder
